key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs undercut the website on 96.8 % of itineraries, albeit by just –0.16 %, and hold 96.8 % offer coverage.
Metasearch delivers the largest discount (–0.23 %) and 100 % fare coverage, pricing below the site on 99.4 % of routes.
GDS prices are lower on 97.4 % of itineraries (–0.16 %), while missing‐fare incidence improved to 2.6 %.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs priced below the airline site on 96.8 % of observed itineraries last week (–0.16 % gap).
Website-only fares rose slightly to 3.2 %, signalling a mild erosion in OTA coverage.
Zero cases of OTAs matching or exceeding website prices keep downward pressure intact.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 3.2 % of website fares were missing on OTAs; the gap widened +1.6 ppts month-over-month.
OTAs remain cheaper on virtually all itineraries with an average –0.16 % delta.
No parity or higher-price instances recorded, eliminating competitive matching risk.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: On all short-haul routes, OTAs repeated the network pattern: 96.8 % cheaper, –0.16 % gap.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 97 % of PT-departure itineraries were cheaper on OTAs; missing offers limited to 3 %.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Lower-fare share dips to 95.1 % while missing offers rise to 4.9 %; discount widens slightly to –0.17 %.
Coverage rebounds to 98.6 % with a stable –0.15 % price gap.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE undercut the airline on 99.4 % of itineraries last week, averaging –0.23 %.
All website fares were present on MSE; no discoverability gaps.
Inside 14 days, lower-fare frequency reached a full 100 % with –0.24 % gap.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Offer-not-found cases stand at 0 % across the sample.
Price parity remains marginal at 0.6 %, stable week-on-week.
Discount magnitude (–0.23 %) leads all channels, with 99.4 % of fares cheaper.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 99.4 % of regional itineraries cheaper on MSE, mirroring network averages.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: PT-origin itineraries exhibit identical 99.4 % lower pricing and –0.23 % gap.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 100 % of close-in fares are lower, erasing previous parity cases; –0.24 % discount sustained.
Far-out bookings maintain a flawless 100 % lower-price record at –0.23 %.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS fares were cheaper on 97 % of itineraries last week with an average –0.16 % delta.
Missing offers fell to 2.6 %, a week-on-week improvement.
No instances of GDS pricing above the website recorded.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Share of cheaper GDS fares inched up +0.47 ppt WoW, –0.16 % average gap.
Offer-not-found cases declined vs. last month, improving inventory parity.
Zero identical or higher prices detected, sustaining discount positioning.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 97.4 % of intra-regional ODs priced lower in GDS (–0.16 %).

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: PT departures mirror overall trend: 97.4 % cheaper in GDS, –0.16 % gap.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS undercut the website on 96.3 % of close-in bookings (–0.17 %), a +0.9 ppt lift WoW.
Far-out trips show 98.7 % cheaper fares with a –0.15 % discount; slight coverage dip WoW.
